00047   RunInfoProcessor::RunInfoProcessor() : Processor("RunInfoProcessor"), _vers_string(""), _vers_length(5)
00048                                          //,_experimentalSetupChange(this,&RunInfoProcessor::experimentalSetupChanged),
00049                                          //_bmlSroRunDataChanged(this, &RunInfoProcessor::setBmlSroRunDataCol),_bmlSroRunDataCol(0)
00050   {
00051     // modify processor description
00052     _description = "Add Runinfo to Runheader needed for MC and DATA" ;
00053     
00054     registerProcessorParameter( "DBInit" ,
00055                                 "initialisation of the database " ,
00056                                 _dbInit ,
00057                                 DBInitString() );
00058     
00059     
00060     //Folder to be searched for the runtime information
00061     //Fixme: we need to make sure that the folders we select here correspond to the 
00062     //Run we have at hand
00063     registerProcessorParameter( "RunTimeFolder",
00064                                 "Collection from DB which contains the start amd stop time of a given run" ,
00065                                 _folderRunTime,
00066                                 std::string("/cd_calice/CALDAQ_RunTimeInfo"));
00067     
00068     
00069     //Folder to be searched for the runlocationinformation
00070     //Fixme: we need to make sure that the folders we select here correspond to the 
00071     //Run we have at hand
00072     registerProcessorParameter( "RunLocationFolder",
00073                                 "Collection from DB which contains information about the location of a run" ,
00074                                 _folderLocation,
00075                                 std::string("/cd_calice/RunLocation"));
00076     
00077     
00078     
00079     //The beam parameter folder
00080     //The string here will be taken if not being set to default 
00081     //If this is not default the user is required to set also the two parameter by hand
00082     //In that case the user is completely responsible for the correct choice of the folder 
00083     //name.
00084     //Setting the value to "non_existing" will force the query of the experimental setup folder
00085     registerProcessorParameter( "BeamParameterFolder",
00086                                 "Folder in which the beam parameters are stored" ,
00087                                 _folderBeamParameter,
00088                                 std::string("default"));
00089     
00090     registerProcessorParameter("CurrentTolerance",
00091                                "Tolerance in % allowed until current reading at run begin and run end is considered to be inconsinstent", 
00092                                _currentTolerance,
00093                                static_cast<float>(0.05));
00094     
00095     registerProcessorParameter("TimeTolerance",
00096                                "Tolerance in s allowed until reading of beam parameters (at run begin) is considered to be outdated", 
00097                                _timeTolerance,
00098                                static_cast<float>(600));
00099     
00100     
00101     //The folder to fall back if no beam parameters are available or if they are odd
00102     //mandatory for desy runs
00103     registerProcessorParameter( "BeamParameterExceptionFolder",
00104                                 "Folder in which beam parameters are stored if not in datastream or if odd" ,
00105                                 _folderBeamParameterException,
00106                                 std::string("/cd_calice/BeamParameterException"));
00107     
00108     
00109     registerProcessorParameter( "BendingCurrentToCheck",
00110                                 "The bending current to be checked to calculate the energy from the current" ,
00111                                 _bendingCurrentToCheck,
00112                                 8);
00113     
00114     //FIXME not sure whether we need to keep these parameters all the tim
00115     //In principle the class containing the beam parameters should know how a beam energy is
00116     //calculated
00117     registerProcessorParameter( "CurrentToEnergy",
00118                                 "Conversion factor from bending magnet current to energy" ,
00119                                 _currentToEnergy,
00120                                 static_cast<float>(4.72));
00121     
00122     registerProcessorParameter( "KeVToMeV",
00123                                 "Convert calculated Beam Energy into MeV" ,
00124                                 _toMeV,
00125                                 static_cast<float>(1000.));
00126     
00127     registerProcessorParameter( "RunNumber" ,
00128                                 "Run number of the run for MC files, in case not written to RunHEader"
00129                                 "A run number in the run header ALWAYS superseeds the steering",
00130                                 _runNumber,
00131                                 int(0)) ;
00132 
00133     registerProcessorParameter( "SafetyMargin",
00134                                 "Apply a safety margin of n seconds between the "
00135                                 "nominal run start and the first MC event "
00136                                 "time stamp to ensure validity of conditions "
00137                                 "data",
00138                                 _safetyMargin,
00139                                 int(0));
00140 
00141    registerProcessorParameter( "OverwriteRunNumber" ,
00142                                 "Overwrite existing run number in run header",
00143                                 _overwriteRunNumber,
00144                                 bool(false)) ;
00145   }

00148   RunInfoProcessor::~RunInfoProcessor() {
00149     if ( _runlocationwhizard ) delete _runlocationwhizard;
00150     if ( _runInformation ) delete _runInformation;
00151   }

00153   void RunInfoProcessor::init() {//init method
00154     
00155     printParameters() ;
00156     
00157     _nRun    = 0;
00158     _nEvt    = 0;
00159     
00160     //CAMM: do we need the ConditionsChangeDelegators? We know the parameters are likely to change each run: why not updating each run anyway directly as done here?
00161     //marlin::ConditionsProcessor::registerChangeListener(&_bmlSroRunDataChanged,_colBmlSroRunData);
00162   }//end init method
00163   
00164   void RunInfoProcessor::processRunHeader( LCRunHeader* run) {
00165 
00166     _runInformation = new RunInformation();
00167     
00168     cout << endl << " ---> RunInfoProcessor::Processing Run Number : " << run->getRunNumber() << endl;
00169     
00170     //#ifdef RECO_DEBUG
00171      LCTOOLS::dumpRunHeader( run ) ;
00172      //#endif
00173 
00174     setVersString(run->getDescription());
00175 
00176     //set the MC flag
00177     bool type = (run->getDetectorName() != "Calice Prototypes") ||  (run->getDescription().find("Mokka") != run->getDescription().npos);
00178     
00179     _runInformation->isMC(type);
00180     
00181     // set run number for MC or if requested for data, too
00182     //plus an (updated) description
00183     std::stringstream description;
00184     //hard coded (oouah) -> to be changed
00185     description << run->getDescription() << "====for reconstruction====" << std::endl 
00186                 << " calice_userlib " << "v06-04" << std::endl
00187                 << " calice_reco v06-06-01" << std::endl
00188                 << " lcio  v02-03-03" << std::endl
00189                 << " marlin  v01-04-01" << std::endl
00190                 << " lccd  v01-02-01" << std::endl
00191                 << " CondDBMySQL_ILC-0-9-5" << std::endl;
00192     
00193     //An existing runnumber ALWAYS superseeds the steering
00194     if( run->getRunNumber() != 0)
00195       {
00196         if (_overwriteRunNumber == false)         
00197           _runNumber = run->getRunNumber();
00198       }
00199 
00200     LCRunModifier::setRun(run,_runNumber, description.str());
00201     if( _runNumber != run->getRunNumber() ) {
00202       std::stringstream message;
00203       message << "RunInfoProcessor::processRunHeader> RunNumber after runheader modification not correct" << std::endl 
00204       << "Run number from run header is: " << run->getRunNumber() << " Value of data member is: " << _runNumber; 
00205       throw std::runtime_error(message.str());
00206     }
00207     printRunParameters(run);
00208     
00209     //Initialize the run location whizard
00210     try{ 
00211     _runlocationwhizard = new RunLocationWhizard(_folderLocation, _dbInit);
00212     _runlocationwhizard->print(_runNumber, std::cout);
00213     
00214     //Fill Location and generic month of running
00215     _runInformation->location(_runlocationwhizard->getRunLocation(_runNumber));     
00216     _runInformation->runMonth (_runlocationwhizard->getGenericRunMonth(_runNumber));
00217     } catch (  lccd::LCCDException & aExc ) {
00218       std::cout << "RunInfoProcessor::ProcessRunHeader> Warning no well defined RunLocation Will return" << std::endl; 
00219       return;
00220     }
00221     //Initilaize the runtime whizard
00222     RunTimeWhizard runtimewhizard(_folderRunTime, _dbInit);    
00223     LCTime starttime(0);
00224     LCTime stoptime(0);
00225     try{
00226       starttime=runtimewhizard.getRunStartTime(_runNumber);
00227     } catch ( lccd::LCCDException & aExc ) {
00228       std::cout << "Warning no starttime found, will set tp 0" <<std::endl;
00229     }
00230     try{
00231       stoptime=runtimewhizard.getRunStopTime(_runNumber);
00232     } catch (  lccd::LCCDException & aExc ) {
00233       std::cout << "Warning no stoptime found, will set tp 0" <<std::endl;
00234     }
00235     _runInformation->runStart(starttime);    
00236     _runInformation->runEnd(stoptime);
00237     std::cout << "Start Time of Run " << _runNumber << " is: " << starttime.getDateString() << std::endl;;      
00238     std::cout << "Stop Time of Run " << _runNumber << " is: " << stoptime.getDateString() << std::endl;;      
00239     // In case of Check if the given run is shorter than the safety margin
00240     if(_runInformation->isMC()) {
00241       if (stoptime.timeStamp() - starttime.timeStamp() > _safetyMargin*NPS) {_eventTime=LCTime(starttime.timeStamp()+_safetyMargin*NPS);
00242       std::cout << "RunInfoProcessor> Event Time of Event after Safety is: " << _eventTime.getDateString() << std::endl; 
00243       }
00244       else {
00245         stringstream message;
00246         message << " Run shorter than given safety margin of "
00247                 << _safetyMargin << " seconds." << endl;
00248         throw runtime_error(message.str());
00249       }
00250       
00251     }
00252 
00253 
00254     //The next part of this method is dedicated to write the beam energy into the 
00255     //run header for mc we may consult the run header in the future
00256     //for data we consult the proper folder in the database
00257     //todo: in case of mc, comparison of mc particle momentume with the actual beam 
00258     //beam energy of the run which is to be simulated?
00259     if(_runInformation->isMC()) LCTOOLS::printParameters( run->getParameters() ) ;
00260     else {
00261       //We test the run info folder to check for a wrong version info on the lcioconverter
00262       //Compose the folder name
00263       std::string foldername_base("/cd_calice_");
00264       std::stringstream foldername; 
00265       foldername << foldername_base << _vers_string << "_" << _runlocationwhizard->getGenericRunType(_runNumber) << "/CALDAQ_RunInfo";
00266       //Get the conditions data handler
00267       IConditionsHandler* conData; 
00268       conData = new DBCondHandler(_dbInit,foldername.str(), "dummy");
00269       //update it 
00270       try {
00271         conData->update(_runInformation->runStart().timeStamp());
00272         //Now we can go ahead and extract the beam energy for this run
00274       } catch ( lcio::Exception & aExc ) {
00275         //We have encountered obviously the situation where the version information needs to be patched.
00276         //Here we put in that we know that the problem occured in the transition between converter version
00277         //v04-01 and v04-02 so we query for the version v04-02 (Note no further patch will be applied).
00278         if(conData) delete conData;
00279         std::cout << "Patching description " << std::endl;
00280         std::stringstream thepatcheddescription;
00281         unsigned int loc = run->getDescription().find_first_of("\n");
00282         for(unsigned int ichar=0; ichar< loc+1; ichar++) thepatcheddescription << run->getDescription()[ichar];
00283         std::string patchstring(" calice_lcioconv v04-02 (converter version patched),\n ");
00284         std::string thesubstr( run->getDescription().substr(run->getDescription().find("calice_userlib")));
00285         thepatcheddescription << patchstring << thesubstr;
00286         setVersString(thepatcheddescription.str());
00287         LCRunModifier::setRun(run,_runNumber, thepatcheddescription.str());
00288         std::cout << "Re-printing Run Parameters: " << std::endl; 
00289         printRunParameters(run);
00290         //now try again with the corrected converter version
00291         std::stringstream foldername; 
00292         foldername << foldername_base << _vers_string << "_" << _runlocationwhizard->getGenericRunType(_runNumber) << "/CALDAQ_RunInfo";
00293         conData = new DBCondHandler(_dbInit,foldername.str(), "dummy");
00294         try{
00295           conData->update(_runInformation->runStart().timeStamp());
00296           //Now we can go ahead and extract the beam energy for this run
00298         } catch ( lcio::Exception & aExc ) {
00299           //If we're here, we simply give up 
00300           std::stringstream message;
00301           message << "RunInfoProcessor::processRunHeader> Failed desperately to find RunInfo Collection for this time stamp." << std::endl 
00302                   << "Please check the integrity of your data";
00303           throw std::runtime_error(message.str());
00304         }
00305       }
00306       if(conData) delete conData;
00307       
00308     }
00309     //todo It looks as if we also need to access the number of DAQ Events here
00310     //... will appear somewhere here
00311     
00312     
00313     //_runInformation->beamEnergyMeV(getBeamEnergy((_runInformation->runStart().timeStamp())+1));
00314     
00315     //Now we have assembled the run information and can set the parameters
00316     _runInformation->set(run);
00317     _runInformation->print();
00318 
00319     
00320     //Count the number of runs 
00321     _nRun++ ;
00322   }
00323   
00324    void RunInfoProcessor::modifyEvent( LCEvent* evt ) {
00325 
00326      if(_runInformation->isMC()) {
00327        // Increase the next event time by one nano second
00328        _eventTime = LCTime(_eventTime.timeStamp() + 1LL);
00329 #ifdef RECO_DEBUG
00330        std::cout << "RunInfoProcessor> Event Time of Event: " << evt->getEventNumber() << " is: " << _eventTime.getDateString() << std::endl; 
00331 #endif
00332     // Modify the run number and the time stamp of each event
00333        static_cast<LCEventImpl*>(evt)->setRunNumber(_runNumber);;
00334        static_cast<LCEventImpl*>(evt)->setTimeStamp(_eventTime.timeStamp());
00335      }
00336   }
00337 
00338   void RunInfoProcessor::processEvent( LCEvent * evt )
00339   {//processEvent method
00340     //Do we need the event counter?
00341     //CAMM: yes, for the cout at the end....
00342     _nEvt ++ ;
00343   }//end process Event method

00353   void RunInfoProcessor::end()
00354   {
00355     cout << endl << "RunInfoProcessor::end()  " << name()
00356          << " processed " << _nEvt << " events in " << _nRun << " runs "
00357          << endl ;
00358   }

00360   void RunInfoProcessor::printRunParameters(const LCRunHeader *run){
00361     
00362     std::cout << "################################" << std::endl <<
00363       " Run parameters : " << std::endl <<
00364       "################################" << std::endl <<
00365       "-------- run number = " << run->getRunNumber() << "," << std::endl <<
00366       "-------- detector name : " << run->getDetectorName() << "," << std::endl <<
00367       "-------- description : " << run->getDescription() << "," << std::endl << 
00368       "-------- liste of active subdetectors : " ;
00369     
00370     const std::vector<std::string>  *vStr=run->getActiveSubdetectors();
00371     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < vStr->size(); i++){
00372       std::cout << "    " << (*vStr)[i];
00373     }
00374     std::cout << "################################" << std::endl;
00375     
00376     const LCParameters &params = run->getParameters();
00377     StringVec intkeys, intkeys2;
00378     intkeys2=params.getIntKeys(intkeys);
00379     std::cout << "Size of intKeys : " << intkeys.size() << ", " << intkeys2.size() << std::endl;
00380     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < intkeys.size(); i++){
00381       std::cout << " Key " << i << " = " << intkeys[i] << ", param=" << params.getIntVal(intkeys[i]) << std::endl;
00382     }
00383     
00384     StringVec floatkeys, floatkeys2;
00385     floatkeys2=params.getFloatKeys(floatkeys);
00386     std::cout << "Size of floatKeys : " << floatkeys.size() << ", " << floatkeys2.size() << std::endl;
00387     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < floatkeys.size(); i++){
00388       std::cout << " Key " << i << " = " << floatkeys[i] << ", param=" << params.getFloatVal(floatkeys[i]) << std::endl;
00389     }
00390     
00391     StringVec stringkeys, stringkeys2;
00392     stringkeys2=params.getStringKeys(stringkeys);
00393     std::cout << "Size of stringKeys : " << stringkeys.size() << ", " << stringkeys2.size() << std::endl;
00394     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < stringkeys.size(); i++){
00395       std::cout << " Key " << i << " = " << stringkeys[i] << ", param=" << params.getStringVal(stringkeys[i]) << std::endl;
00396     }
00397     
00398   }

00402   //Obtain the beam energy
00403   //set get method???
00404   unsigned int RunInfoProcessor::getBeamEnergy(const LCCDTimeStamp startTime) {
00405     std::string foldertoaccess("");
00406     std::stringstream foldername; 
00407     
00408     if(_folderBeamParameter == "default") {
00409       std::string foldername_base("/cd_calice_");
00410       foldername << foldername_base << _vers_string << "_" << _runlocationwhizard->getGenericRunType(_runNumber) << "/CALDAQ_BmlSroRunData" << _runlocationwhizard->getRunLocation(_runNumber);
00411       std::cout << "Composed Foldername for beam parameters: "<< foldername.str() << std::endl;
00412       _folderBeamParameter=foldername.str();     
00413       foldername.str("");
00414       foldername << "/cd_calice/BeamParameterException";
00415       std::cout << "Composed foldername for beam parameter exception: " << foldername.str() << std::endl;
00416       _folderBeamParameterException=foldername.str();     
00417     }  else { 
00418       //Now treat the user defined case
00419       std::cout << "User defined case: " << std::endl;
00420       std::cout << "Using folder: " << _folderBeamParameter << " to extract beam parameters" << std::endl;
00421       std::cout << "Using folder: " << _folderBeamParameterException << " in case exceptions are to be handled" << std::endl;
00422     }
00423     
00424     //consult function which handles beam parameters 
00425     //todo to be replaced by a dedicated class?
00426     return handleBeamParameters(startTime);
00427   }
00428   
00429   unsigned int RunInfoProcessor::handleBeamParameters(const LCCDTimeStamp starttime){
00430     
00431     //Initialization of variables
00432     unsigned int energy(0);
00433     IConditionsHandler* conData= new DBCondHandler(_dbInit,_folderBeamParameter, "dummy","") ;
00434     IConditionsHandler* conDataBeamException(0);      
00435     
00436     LCTime startTime(starttime);
00437     LCTime till(0);
00438     LCTime since(0);
00439     LCTime cernTimeStamp(0);
00440     std::string till_string("");
00441     std::string since_string("");
00442     //std::vector<double> bendCurrents;
00443     double bendCurBofr = 0;
00444     double bendCurEofr = 0;
00445     bool havebofr(false);
00446     bool haveeofr(false);
00447     LCCollection* colE(0);
00448     
00449     //Extract the beam parameters at run begin
00450     try {
00451       conData->update(startTime.timeStamp()) ;
00452       colE = conData->currentCollection();
00453       CALICE::BmlSlowRunDataBlock bmlSlowRunDataBlock(colE->getElementAt(0));
00454       //bmlSlowRunDataBlock.print(std::cout);
00455       bendCurBofr = bmlSlowRunDataBlock.getBendCurrents().at(_bendingCurrentToCheck);
00456       cernTimeStamp = bmlSlowRunDataBlock.getTimeStamp();
00457       till_string =  colE->getParameters().getStringVal((lccd::DBTILL).c_str());
00458       till = static_cast<long64>(strtoll(till_string.c_str(),0,0));
00459       since_string =  colE->getParameters().getStringVal((lccd::DBSINCE).c_str());
00460       since = static_cast<long64>(strtoll(since_string.c_str(),0,0));
00461       //std::cout << "till: " << till.getDateString() << std::endl;
00462       havebofr=true;
00463     } catch ( lcio::Exception & aExc ) {
00464       std::cout << "No beam parameter information at begin of run for run: " << _runNumber << std::endl;
00465     }
00466     
00467     //extract the beam parameters at run end
00468     try {
00469       //  NM: The next line is buggy
00470       //      'till' is the end of the validity of the beamline collection, which is valid at run start
00471       //      which is NOT the end of the run
00472       //      correct should be: till->runStopTime
00473       conData->update(till.timeStamp()) ;  
00474       //      otherwise, the next call gives back exactly the same collection as before 
00475       colE = conData->currentCollection();
00476       CALICE::BmlSlowRunDataBlock bmlSlowRunDataBlock(colE->getElementAt(0));
00477       //bmlSlowRunDataBlock.print(std::cout);
00478       bendCurEofr = bmlSlowRunDataBlock.getBendCurrents().at(_bendingCurrentToCheck);
00479       //      Since the collection is identical, the validity does not change and the next
00480       //      line does not alter 'till'
00481       till_string =  colE->getParameters().getStringVal((lccd::DBTILL).c_str());
00482       till = static_cast<long64>(strtoll(till_string.c_str(),0,0));
00483       haveeofr=true;
00484       energy=static_cast<unsigned int>(fabs(bendCurEofr)/_currentToEnergy*_toMeV);
00485       
00486     } catch ( lcio::Exception & aExc ) {
00487       std::cout << "No beam parameter information and end of run for run: " << _runNumber << std::endl;
00488     }
00489     
00490     //Handle exceptions
00491     //1) Reading at BoR or EoR missing or Wrong timestamp 
00492     if((!havebofr || !haveeofr) || abs(abs(since.unixTime()-cernTimeStamp.unixTime())-timeCor()) > _timeTolerance) {
00493       std::cout << "BeamParameterException detected: " << std::endl;
00494       std::cout << "Exists reading Begin of Run? " << havebofr  << std::endl;
00495       std::cout << "Exists reading End of Run? " << haveeofr  << std::endl;
00496       std::cout << "Difference between cern and DAQ timestamp: " << abs(abs(since.unixTime()-cernTimeStamp.unixTime())-timeCor()) << " s" << " Tolerance: " << _timeTolerance << " s" << std::endl;
00497       std::string colName = "BeamParameterExceptionCol";
00498       conDataBeamException = new lccd::DBCondHandler( _dbInit, _folderBeamParameterException, colName, "" ) ;
00499       try{
00500         conDataBeamException->update( static_cast<lccd::LCCDTimeStamp>(_runNumber));
00501         LCCollection* col = conDataBeamException->currentCollection();
00502         //Obtain the energy if possible
00503         BeamParameterException beamParameter(col->getElementAt(0));
00504 #ifdef RECO_DEBUG 
00505         beamParameter.print(std::cout);
00506 #endif       
00507         return beamParameter.getBeamEnergy();
00508       } catch  ( lcio::Exception & aExc ) {
00509         std::cout << "No beam parameter exception information for run: " << _runNumber << std::endl;
00510         std::cout << "Beam Energy will be set to 0 " << std::endl;
00511         return 0;
00512       }
00513       
00514       
00515     }
00516     
00517     //b) Inconistent readings between begin and end of run
00518     if( (havebofr && haveeofr) && ( fabs((bendCurBofr-bendCurEofr)/bendCurBofr) > _currentTolerance)) {
00519       std::cout << "BeamParameterException detected: " << std::endl;
00520       std::cout << "Bending current at Begin of Run: " << bendCurBofr << " A" << std::endl;
00521       std::cout << "Bending current at End   of Run: " << bendCurEofr << " A" << std::endl;
00522       std::cout << "Tolerance                      : " << _currentTolerance << " %" << std::endl;
00523        std::string colName = "BeamParameterExceptionCol";
00524        conDataBeamException = new lccd::DBCondHandler( _dbInit, _folderBeamParameterException, colName, "" ) ;
00525       try {
00526         conDataBeamException->update(static_cast<lccd::LCCDTimeStamp>(_runNumber));
00527         LCCollection* col = conDataBeamException->currentCollection();
00528         //Obtain the energy
00529         BeamParameterException beamParameter(col->getElementAt(0));
00530 #ifdef RECO_DEBUG 
00531         beamParameter.print(std::cout);
00532 #endif       
00533         return beamParameter.getBeamEnergy();
00534       } catch ( lcio::Exception & aExc ) {  
00535         std::cout << "No beam parameter exception information for run: " << _runNumber << std::endl;
00536         std::cout << "Beam Energy will be set to 0 " << std::endl;
00537         return 0;
00538       }
00539     }
00540     
00541     delete conData;
00542     if(conDataBeamException) delete conDataBeamException;
00543     std::cout << "Bending current from database is : " << bendCurEofr << " A." << std::endl;
00544     std::cout << "Energy from database is : " << bendCurEofr/_currentToEnergy*_toMeV << " MeV." << std::endl;
00545     return energy;
00546   }
00547   
00548   
00549   void RunInfoProcessor::setVersString(std::string description){
00550     
00551     //Parsing the run description string to get the converter version major and minor (not the debugging cycles)
00552     int ifound(0);
00553     std::string vers_string("");
00554     //Check for the place in the string in which the converter version is given
00555     for (unsigned int ichar=description.find_first_of(" ",description.find("calice_lcioconv"))+1; 
00556          ichar < description.size();ichar++) {
00557       //if(run->getDescription()[ichar] != " " && atoi(run->getDescription()[ichar]) != atoi("-")){
00558       if( description[ichar] != ' ' && description[ichar] != '-' ){
00559         //std::cout << "Character at: " << ichar << " is: " << run->getDescription()[ichar] << std::endl;
00560         vers_string+= description[ichar];
00561         ifound++;
00562       }
00563       if(ifound==_vers_length) break;
00564     }
00565     _vers_string=vers_string;
00566     std::cout << "vers string is: " << _vers_string << std::endl;
00567     
00568   }
00569   
00570   float RunInfoProcessor::timeCor() {
00571     
00572     std::cout << std::endl;
00573     std::cout << "******************************************************************************************* " << std::endl;
00574     std::cout << "RunInfoProcessor::timeCor: Reading HARDCODED values to correct time stamps of cern database " << std::endl;
00575     std::cout << "TO BE CHANGED to external input!!!!!" << std::endl;    
00576     std::cout << "******************************************************************************************* " << std::endl;
00577     //The time at which cern has adjusted its clock (i.e. cern is synchronous to calice 
00578     if(_runInformation->runStart().timeStamp() > LCTime( 2006,8, 1, 0 , 0 , 0 ).timeStamp() && 
00579        _runInformation->runStart().timeStamp() < LCTime( 2006,8, 23, 3 , 0 , 0 ).timeStamp()) return 480;
00580     
00581     //cern has switched its clock from CEST -> UTC (was not recongnized by converter, not omnipotent ;-) ) 
00582     if(_runInformation->runStart().timeStamp() > LCTime( 2006,10, 1, 0 , 0 , 0 ).timeStamp() && 
00583        _runInformation->runStart().timeStamp() < LCTime( 2006,10, 29, 2 , 0 , 0 ).timeStamp()) return 7200;
00584     
00585     //General switch from CEST -> CET
00586     if(_runInformation->runStart().timeStamp() > LCTime( 2006,10, 29, 1 , 59 , 59 ).timeStamp() && 
00587        _runInformation->runStart().timeStamp() < LCTime( 2007, 3, 25, 2 , 0 , 0 ).timeStamp()) return 3600;
00588 
00589     //  NM: crude guess - switched back to CEST for summer 2007
00590     if(_runInformation->runStart().timeStamp() > LCTime( 2007, 3, 25, 2 , 0 , 0 ).timeStamp() && 
00591        _runInformation->runStart().timeStamp() < LCTime( 2007,10, 29, 2 , 0 , 0 ).timeStamp()) return 7200;
00592     return 0;
00593   }
